CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 26, 1953, pg. 32 reads: " Civilian Defense Training - Training for Air Raid Wardens as a part of the local civilian defense set-up began last Monday at Hill City. Charles T. Miller, standing, Mrs. Eunice W. Cook, who has been appointed Chief Warden of Zone 2, and Edward J. Gorman, deputy chief zone warden are the instructors.  Members of the initial class which is designed to train volunteers who in turn will train others, are , left to right: Arnold Wilson, Robert Ruffin and Mr. and Mrs. Leander Wright.  in the rear are Mrs. Mayme Burgess, Mrs. Robert Williams, Mrs. Minerva Brice, Mrs. Lacey Tabb, Mrs. Ruth Travis and Mrs. Bessie Powell. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Instructors Charles T. Miller, standing, Eunice W. Cook, and Edward J. Gorman, training Air Raid Warden volunteers, first row, seated Arnold Wilson, Robert Ruffin, and Mr. and Mrs. Leander Wright;  second row including Mayme Burgess, Mrs. Robert Williams, Minerva Brice, Lacey Tabb, Ruth Travis, and/or Bessie Powell, in Hill City with checkered floor
